definition: to grab/to catch/to arrest/to snatch/to scratch

sentences.english: Through the trial, was initially arrested the two men and Lim Yang.
sentences.chinese: 通过审讯，最初被抓获的两男子为任某和杨某。

sentences.english: Had the policemen arrived immediately, the criminal would have been caught.
sentences.chinese: 若是警察立刻到，就会抓获罪犯。

sentences.english: Her ship is crewed by beautiful young maids who geld every male they capture.
sentences.chinese: 她带领着一船年轻少女，阉掉每个抓获的男人。

sentences.english: Tanks rumbled down the streets of Deraa, trying to seize the city back from protesters.
sentences.chinese: 坦克驶进德拉的街头，试图抓获回城的抗议者。

sentences.english: Jim absconded abroad, then was caught aboard a ship.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆潜逃到国外，后来在船上被抓获。

sentences.english: Xu was arrested in the second half hour, Liu coming out of their own.
sentences.chinese: 就在许某被抓获后半小时，刘某自己现身了。

sentences.english: The thieves are cau with their loot by the police.
sentences.chinese: 警察抓获了小偷及其赃物。

sentences.english: The aim was to capture or kill LRA's elusive leader Joseph Kony.But the offensive failed.
sentences.chinese: 其目的是抓获或杀死上帝抵抗军的领导人约瑟夫科尼。

sentences.english: The escaped convict was seized outside the city.
The English murderer was caught by the French police and extradited to Britain.
sentences.chinese: 那个英国杀人犯被法国警察抓获引渡回英国。

sentences.english: The police kept after the criminal until they finally caught him.
sentences.chinese: 警方对那个罪犯紧追不舍，直至最后把他抓获。

sentences.english: In 2004, Yu-ming in the Chongqing robbery was arrested.
sentences.chinese: 2004年，于得明在重庆抢劫时被抓获。

sentences.english: Investigators tracked down and arrested five men.
sentences.chinese: 调查人员跟踪并抓获了5个罪犯。

sentences.english: The aim was to capture or kill LRA's elusive leader Joseph Kony.
sentences.chinese: 其目的是抓获或杀死上帝抵抗军的领导人约瑟夫科尼。

sentences.english: He was captured and executed shortly after her demise.
sentences.chinese: 在她的死亡后不久，他被抓获并被处死。

sentences.english: The American murderer was caught by the English police and extradited to America.
sentences.chinese: 那名美国杀人犯在英国被警方抓获后被引渡到美国。

definition: (of a bird, fish etc) to be caught in a net/(of a tennis ball) to hit the net/(of a criminal) to be captured
to track down and seize (a criminal suspect, contraband etc)
to uncover (a criminal plot)/to break open and capture
to be at large (of a criminal)
to make a full confession/to plead guilty
to fall into the net of justice (idiom); finally arrested
to bring to justice/to file away (a document)
